articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pounded Rafah with airstrikes and tank fire on Tuesday, pressing its offensive in Gaza's southern city despite international condemnation of an attack that sparked a blaze in a tent camp for the displaced, killing at least 45 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces press Rafah offensive despite global outcry

articles.author: Jack Queen, Luc Cohen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: A New York prosecutor told jurors that Donald Trump engaged in a conspiracy to corrupt the 2016 election and then tried to cover it up, as lawyers made their closing arguments in the former U.S. president's criminal hush money trial on Tuesday.
articles.title: Prosecutor says Trump hush money payment undermined 2016 election as trial nears end

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: The Biden administration on Tuesday said it was closely monitoring the probe into a deadly Israeli airstrike it called beyond tragic, but that the recent deaths in Rafah didn't constitute a major operation there that crosses red lines.
articles.title: US says latest Rafah deaths won't impact Israel policy, military aid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain, Ireland and Norway officially recognised a Palestinian state on Tuesday, despite an angry reaction from Israel, which has found itself increasingly isolated after more than seven months of conflict in Gaza.
articles.title: Spain, Ireland and Norway recognise Palestinian statehood

articles.author: Alexander Winning
articles.description: South Africans vote on Wednesday in the most competitive election since the end of apartheid, with opinion polls suggesting the African National Congress (ANC) will lose its parliamentary majority after 30 years in government.
articles.title: South Africans vote in most competitive election since end of apartheid

articles.author: Harold Isaac
articles.description: Haiti's transition council on Tuesday tapped former Prime Minister Garry Conille, who briefly led the country over a decade ago, to return to the role as the Caribbean nation works to restore stability and take back control from violent gangs.
articles.title: Haiti transition council taps former PM Conille to again lead country

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: The United States expressed deep concern to Israel's government over an airstrike in Rafah and urged an investigation as soon as it saw reports of the incident, the State Department said on Tuesday, adding that Washington will closely watch the results of Israel's probe.
articles.title: US expressed deep concern to Israel over Rafah airstrike, State Department says

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Georgia's parliament voted on Tuesday to override a presidential veto of a bill on "foreign agents" that has plunged the South Caucasus country into crisis, ignoring criticism from the West which says the legislation is authoritarian and Russian-inspired.
articles.title: Georgian parliament votes to override presidential veto of 'foreign agent' bill

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the West on Tuesday that NATO members in Europe were playing with fire by proposing to let Ukraine use Western weapons to strike inside Russia, which he said could trigger a global conflict.
articles.title: Putin warns West not to let Ukraine use its missiles to hit Russia

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Katharine Jackson
articles.description: The White House on Tuesday provided the most complete definition yet of what it considers a "major ground operation" in Rafah that could trigger a change in United States policy toward Israel, and said Israel's actions there have not yet reached that level.
articles.title: US defines 'major' Rafah operation that would change Israel policy
